It's funny, on the local web store LotR LCG is listed as a "hit" (meaning a lot of people buy it), but when I asked that retailer to host the Fellowship event, he instantly refused and ceased and further discussion about it.
I'm always surprised to hear so many stories of game stores being s%$#y about hosting these events.

I would understand their hesitance to host an event if LotR LCG was not popular around, but their own site claims it to be a "hit". And by refusing to host the event so harsly, they make me question the credibility of the whole "hit" thing. However, there is no alternative convinient way to get anything boardgame related around here, so little I can do about it.
Have game stores hosting been given info? GameKastle in the Bay Area applied to take part but (as I understand it) has had no confirmation...

It seems that some have and some haven't. Truth be told, FFG organized play can be a bit disorganized sometimes (heh). Anyway, which Game Kastle applied? If they get accepted, I might have to mosey down there if Games of Berkeley doesn't get it.

> It seems that some have and some haven't. Truth be told, FFG organized play can be a bit disorganized sometimes (heh). 

I wish FFG would send the kits out or whatever.  I don't know if the store I got to order the kits will get it in or not... and it would be nice to know.  How can I drum up support and get people to show up if the store doesn't know if they're even going to get the kits to host the event?

I have seen this kind of thing with other companies, it's hard to prioritise what is (usually) a loss leader like this when human resources are already pretty thinly stretched, but at the same time, it really is super important, especially to the hardcore fans who tend to get others into the hobby. Hopefully FFG will get to it soon. I know there are a ton of other tournaments getting going now as well. I think LotR:LCG is a bit niche by comparison.

I don't want to add this officially, but I was chatting with a worker at the Uncommons in NYC tonight, and apparently they will have the stuff available for a Fellowship event but weren't convinced it would be popular enough to actually run an official one. So they were just going to run it for themselves, essentially. But if enough interest could be drummed up, they would consider making it public again (although perhaps not on the official event weekend).

 

So, NYC LotR LCG players unite! If you might be able to attend, show your support by sending them a declaration of interest here:
